channel.title: Astronomical event of the Day
channel.description: RSS feed of the astronomical event of the day.

item.title: ASASSN-14li
item.description: ASASSN-14li was a tidal disruption event that occurred when a moderately massive star of 3 solar masses and significant CNO processing was tidally disrupted by a supermassive black hole in a galaxy around 290 million light years from Earth. However it could have been a low mass star that has been stripped of its envelope. If the star turns out to be around 3 solar masses, it would be one of the largest stars known to have experienced a tidal disruption event. The debris from the disrupted star showed relatively high amounts of nitrogen and carbon. These elements were created during the tidal disruption event.
